website_summaries.verdict: If you simply must have the longest zoom in the room, the Canon PowerShot SX50 HS satisfies.
pros: The Canon PowerShot SX50 HS has an extraordinary zoom range with excellent image stabilization and fine photo quality for a megazoom
plenty of shooting modes, from full auto to full manual
and a hot shoe for adding an external flash
cons: Its lens and high-ISO picture quality make it less desirable for shooting indoors or in low light, especially without a tripod
A couple of things about the design of the controls might make shooting frustrating for some users
Outside of its long lens, its features and performance are slightly behind competing models

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I also own the Canon G-12, which I have been very pleased with, because it takes stunning pictures for a point and shoot camera. However, I wanted a better zoom in a point and shoot, so that I could get closer to subjects such as birds. This camera does that beautifully. What a thrill to be able to zoom in and focus on a bird's eye! The camera is light, compact, and simple to use. All I want to do is to just take pictures quickly when I see something I want to capture, without a lot of fussing with lenses and settings, etc. Perfect camera for me.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera.
customer_reviews.text: I am an amateur who gave up the frustration of film photography decades ago. This camera surmounts all of that frustration as it is actually a hand-held computer that happens to take excellent digital pictures and videos. It's smart and allows me to concentrate my attention upon the subject at hand. I love that I do not have to carry extra lenses, but can rapidly change from wide angle to telephoto without degradation of image. I bought this rather than a newer model because I did not feel the need an escalation in megapixels which reduces image quality in low-light conditions.
customer_reviews.author: David Hopkinson

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel
customer_reviews.text: I spent quite a while researching cameras before landing on this one. After practicing with this camera, I have people with much more expensive cameras asking me what I purchased based upon the quality of pictures it produces. It can be point and shoot or you can play with much more advanced settings. More importantly, although bigger than a "pocket" camera, this camera has one (very flexible) lens that makes it much lighter and more compact than many costlier camera systems. If you want a camera that allows you to take great pictures but is still small enough to actually carry with you on family trips and vacations, this is a great choice!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Lesser

customer_reviews.title: Perfect camera for everybody.
customer_reviews.text: I had ten cameras before this one, but any of those had the features this one has. It is perfect for intermediate or maybe advanced photographers. The quality of the pictures is 100% perfect. Indoor and outdoor. Months ago a friend of mine an his wife hired a professional photographer to take pictures of them in the beach. When I knew about that I asked him to do the same with my camera, I mean take the pictures later than the other guy. He Agreed and at the end the pictures from the other guy and mine do not have any difference in quality. Both are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: on standard zoom the IS works great. I often times keep my PowerShot SX50 on ...
customer_reviews.text: I take this little gem on every hike I go on. Why? I have a 400mm Canon L, and anyone who has carried that baby around knows how heavy it is. At my age, light is right! I've taken some what for me are remarkable pictures. Yes, on 2X you must have a tripod; but, on standard zoom the IS works great. I often times keep my PowerShot SX50 on a tripod near my hummingbird feeders. Just got back from Rosebud Creek in Montana. I've included some of my birding shots. My recommendation is BUY BABY BUY before Canon gets smarter than they already are and jacks the price up!
customer_reviews.author: HJSV

customer_reviews.title: Meets Expectations
customer_reviews.text: This camera's biggest selling point is its 24 - 1200mm optical zoom. From its widest to its closest distance, the quality is surprisingly solid. In daylight, the autofocus performs well. The poorest aspect of the camera is its internal viewfinder. It's difficult to view any image distortion-free, which makes the manual focus option problematic. The flip-out viewfinder, which also rotates nicely, provides an acceptable but not dazzling image. The camera's menu is a little congested, and it's easy to launch a menu item while rotating the menu/iris wheel while prepping for a shot. The reason for owning this camera is its 1200mm lens, and on that account it meets expectations. It's a good adjunct camera for a DSLR shooter.
customer_reviews.author: Kel Stanford

customer_reviews.title: Good quality pictures and impressive zoom capability
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this camera. Whenever I watch concerts, I'm able to zoom in pretty well to the performers and produce sharp, good quality pictures (just set the ISO setting to high at night) even when I'm far away from the stage. Considering that this is not a DLSR camera, it is very impressive. I've been using this camera for at least 3 years now especially when I travel. I don't like carrying around a DLSR camera because it's too heavy. This one is point-and-shoot and the quality is good and sharp enough for what I want. It also has different settings for different conditions.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bautista

customer_reviews.title: A great, lightweight and powerful little camera.
customer_reviews.text: My main camera is a Nikon D7000 which I love but is for some reason getting heavier as I get older! I wanted a camera that was light weight, flexible and produced good pictures. I read a number of positive reports about it on my photography forum and decided to give it a try. Wow! I love it! It goes with me everywhere for 90% of my picture taking. It is light, easy to use and has terrific zoom capabilities at 50X. I still use my favorite D7000 but mostly at home or where I don't have to have it hanging around my neck for hours on end. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Fezz

customer_reviews.title: great zoom
customer_reviews.text: I thought this has a 2.8 lens, but it does not. I havent use it at night yet. This is an addition to the $0X, that is a 2.8 lens. But this has greater zoom, so i will test it out by taking pictures of the moon. With such a zoom, a tripod is a must. if there is enough light, I have taken pics hand held, but no advise at night time.
customer_reviews.author: seldom satisfied

customer_reviews.title: SX50 is my carry around camera
customer_reviews.text: I have loved superzoom cameras ever since I started with a Nikon E8800. When Nikon did not expand their superzoom series, I switched to Canon and went through the S3, S5, SX10, SX20, SX30, and became infatuated with the SX50. I have stuck with the SX50 for my point and shoot camera that I carry whenever out and about since I can tuck it in my custom altered photo vest (my uniform) rather than lug around my EOS 60D or 80D. My wife Melody also uses an SX50 – as her regular camera.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Wambeke

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy I bought this camera and like many of it's features, notably the 50x optical zoom. It takes great action shots, it will bring in those wildlife shots that were impossible before IF you have sufficient light. Image stabilization is quite good and I'm very happy with the videos it takes. The strap and lens cap are both a hassle, but if you have the time you can store the cap on the strap and it's acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth C. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with Az Select.
customer_reviews.text: I like the product, but will never deal with Az Select again. It didn't come with a neck strap, the DVD or an SD card, though it was pictured in the ad. Their response to my comments and rating were very slow also.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Hill

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Zoom from a Rugged Camera
customer_reviews.text: It's the 50X zoom that really makes this camera. I have gotten shots with that zoom that I otherwise would not have gotten. This camera also takes very nice night shots just using the available light. I just returned from Cambodia and took some striking photos of the street vendors using just the light from their carts; the effect was visually arresting. It is possible to use up a battery before the day ends (but only if it's a heavy shooting day) so I always carry a spare battery. The camera seems rugged enough to survive international travel; I've taken it to Africa, Spain, and Asia and its continued to perform well.
customer_reviews.author: Carol J.

customer_reviews.title: ... the past 40 years and this one is the best camera I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I have used Canon cameras for the past 40 years and this one is the best camera I have ever owned. I do a lot of wild bird photography and this camera can really reach out and get those bird shots that can't be achieved using just a 250 or 300mm lens. It also gives you the telephoto ability without having to lug a heavy camera bag around with you and changing lenses. For a point and shoot camera this is the one I would recommend to anyone. I only gave this product 5 stars because there wasn't a 10 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mumm

customer_reviews.title: Moving on up!
customer_reviews.text: I'm moving up from one of those little pocket cameras. This takes lovely images on auto and as I learn more about photograph it can be set to manual. The option buttons are set quite close together, so if you have a large hand--which I don't--or arthritic hands--which I do--care must be taken or the camera does al kinds of things unexpectedly. Still, very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Rose Realy Obl OSB

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome camera. Still learning all it's features but am ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome camera. Still learning all it's features but am totally pleased with it (owned it about a year). I am a point and shoot kind of photographer (totally for myself and family) who want to capture the memories, which this camera does very well. Some more expensive camera's might allow more creative input to pictures but that is not what I am about. It does have all the manual modes if that is your thing.
customer_reviews.author: happy clicker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Side Camera
customer_reviews.text: I own a Canon 5D Mark III and wanted something smaller for when I do big hikes in the woods, go to sporting events, among other things which I don't want or feel the need to carry the 5D. This camera does exactly that, and has tons of features which I wouldn't expect from a Point and Shoot. The movie mode for instance is just flat out superb and allows you to zoom in far far away. You also have the ability to shoot in RAW format which was my main reason for buying the camera. Highly recommend for someone wanting to experience photography in a small compact way, while having the versatility of those with professional gear.
customer_reviews.author: Kiel

customer_reviews.title: Very good bridge camera
customer_reviews.text: Really fun camera comes up with some great shots. Doesn't substitute for a DSLR, don't kid yourself--won't take action shots well, or in low-light. But this is easy to carry, comes up with accurate, vibrant, in-focus shots from all over--I have a lovely photo taken at full extension of a bright cardinal sitting in snow taken last winter that looks great. Great travel camera, as well as for other uses. It's limitation for travel purposes is that it won't fit in your pocket, but it's still easy to carry and will get you a range of cameras that only a few cameras can pull off well.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Katz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera. It has a lot of the capabilities ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera. It has a lot of the capabilities of a DSLR. It isn't great for night photos, but the built in zoom is amazing. If you shoot on RAW it gets very slow. I use the sports setting sometimes to get action shots which works well. You can add filters with a 58mm adapter. The viewfinder isn't very good, but otherwise, it's a wonderful camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne J. Martin

customer_reviews.title: I'm far from a good photographer but this camera still takes very good vacation ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm far from a good photographer but this camera still takes very good vacation pictures in my hands. Was very good for the vast distances out west last year. Got some very good shots of bears close to a mile away. Zoom is great though requires a tripod at any great distance. Also, there are very loud "clicks" on the recording when the zoom starts or stops when shooting video but I did t buy this primarily as a video camera. Overall very happy with it and will be taking it on vacation again this year.
customer_reviews.author: Nate H

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera does everything I was hoping for, including an incredible amount of optical zoom, for a very good price. The photo quality is astounding and the stabilization is great, even at high zoom. Although I prefer to use a tripod when using the higher levels of zoom I have taken some shots hand held and the stabilization is truly amazing. I have taken shots of hawks soaring behind my house and some macro shots as well and have been very pleased with the results. Of course this isn't a DSLR, but for my level of photography this camera meets all my needs without spending a fortune on a high end DSLR and several very pricey lenses.
customer_reviews.author: R. Horn

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Got it for my wife for Christmas 2014 & she still loves it 1 1/2 years later. I wish that she'd use it a bit more, but phone cameras are just so convenient. We do love the quality of the pictures. With that said, neither of us is a professional photographer or uses it for such purposes, but we do love all of the features of this camera. Having both a viewfinder and a digital screen viewer makes this camera so easy to use in almost any kind of light or circumstances.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: this was the best micro-zoom camera and lenses on the market
customer_reviews.text: I have now owned two of these. Because of indecision on buying a replacement when my first one crapped out after 6 years of heavy use, I bought a used one on eBay until I could figure out what to do next. At the time they were released, this was the best micro-zoom camera and lenses on the market. But Canon seems to have abandoned this space leaving Nikon to own it with their 900 and 1000 models that may not have lenses quite as good as this Canon, but the zoom technology now BLOWS THIS AWAY. All that said, this was THE BOMB when it was released, and I will use it enthusiastically until I get my Nikon 1000.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey RR Skrentny

customer_reviews.title: Great pro-sumer camera w/o breaking the bank
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera--it is like a "pro-sumer" model. It has elements of a "pro" DSLR camera, but it's size is manageable (vs the DSLR's). Note that this model is larger than a typical point-and-shoot camera. The 50X zoom is great--I use it all the time (I use a monopod to help me stabilize the camera). The high speed shots are great also, but you only get to take some (maybe 7-8 max), while a DSLR would allow you to take more.
customer_reviews.author: M_Robles

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, for those that don't want to spend top buck on a DSLR. This one, as many have stated is a great family camera. I am just learning all the features it has, it takes great video and the picture images. I am just starting as an amateur photographer and I am very happy with. It does have some issues with taking pictures at night, but you just have to adjust your ISO and settings accordingly. Not a DSLR quality but close, Read reviews throughout the internet, watch reviews on youtube. As a hint, buy an extra battery, the video mode takes a toll on power. Absolutely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio MT

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade/replacement for previous version I dropped into the ocean.
customer_reviews.text: I dropped my previous version Canon powershot into the ocean and they have improved them since then. I love the image stabilizer when using the very long zoom capability. I can make a video at full zoom and it is amazingly smooth without the normal shakies that my zoomed videos used to have. The stabilizer also work for zoomed photos to make it easier to get a clear photo at long zoom.
customer_reviews.author: S. Leiphart

customer_reviews.title: Still a working camera.
customer_reviews.text: Owned for 6 years and still use it. Image stabilization is a valuable tool as I age. The camera took great solar eclipse pictures last summer and bald eagle pictures this winter. A camera for many applications. Not new but still works. Updated 7/1/19. Updated after 7 years to Nikon p900 for 24-2000 mm zoom, 16 mp sensor, and foremost a GPS. Liked the sx50 but no GPS.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence W. Lass

customer_reviews.title: Incredible ZOOOOM!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most amazing zoom you can imagine. It's better than a pair of binoculars. It's as simple or as complicated as you want to make it. It's got a million settings if you're an expert photographer and want to get into shutter speed and exposure time and all that. It's a good price so it works well for a semi-serious travelers who likes to take nice pictures that can be framed for home. That's me. But the zoom is just amazing. You can get up close and personal with a flying hawk. Have to learn to keep the camera still which to me means finding a solid object and adjusting the camera from a solid base.
customer_reviews.author: Destination Pittsburgh

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Although this isn't as good as a DSLR in terms of quality, it still is better than a point and shoot camera. It has a view finder, which is really great while videoing one self. It's much lighter than a Dslr, which makes it easier to carry around (DSLR's are quite heavy, no joke). The battery life is decent. It's a pretty good camera for the price it is being sold for
customer_reviews.author: Manoue

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of gear!
customer_reviews.text: I am still learning to use this, but it is a wonderful machine. The 'reach' on the zoom lens is just unbelievable. There are many pictures available around the net of the moon taken with the sx50, and it fills most of the frame. I have photos of squirrels up in trees, and with the wide-angle look, you cannot see them at all. Zoomed in, you can fill the frame with the head and shoulders alone. If you want to equal this with a dslr, be prepared to spend at least 10 times the price. Would the pictures be better? Sure, but I say again, 10 times the price! One of my best purchases ever...
customer_reviews.author: Phil Buglass

customer_reviews.title: Some neat features and great pics for the amatures out there.
customer_reviews.text: Good all round camera for the person who wants to be a little lazy and just take the shot and let the camera do the work. Absolute favorite feature is ability to swivel the screen facing forward to make sure everyone is in the frame when using the timer or just taking a "selfie". Also, the "hand held nite scene" mode is great for low light indoor pics where you don't want to use a flash (like in a museum where you are not supposed to be taking pictures). Schooshhh! Don't tell anyone........
customer_reviews.author: Caveman

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot SX50 Digital Cameria Review
customer_reviews.text: I have been using cameras for years but have never seen the ease of opperation for this camera. With very little experience, the average person can take photos of high quality and wonderful movies. I'm stiil exploring the camera but, am really satisfied with 1) the ease of starting to use the camera, 2) the ability to use the zoom feature and get great in-focus photos and, 3) the everyday ease of operation. I would recommend this unit for the experienced, as well as the novice photographer.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Jansen Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Wow - what a camera!  Who needs a DSLR!
customer_reviews.text: I recently upgraded from the SX30 for the greater zoom, and also bought a T3i DSLR. I wasn't crazy about the SX30 because of some yellow tint in some photos, which I now realize was probably due to white balance issues. So let's talk about zoom. I compared the zoom on this little baby to my DSLR with a 100-400 mm DSLR lens with a 2 x extender, about $2,000 worth of lenses. Well, I found the SX50 actually took a sharper picture, and this is in a very low light environment. I could not be more impressed. Go Canon! It makes me wonder why I bothered investing thousands of dollars into my DSLR and associated lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Z

customer_reviews.title: Great value! Great zoom! Great for birders!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera -- I am a birder and online posts indicate this is a good camera for taking pictures of birds. It is user friendly, there are lots of online you tube tutorials for this camera. It looked like new and came quickly. I chose this camera because a fellow birder uses this, and because of my experience, another birder friend ordered one as well. Some of the attached photos are back yard, a couple were quite a distance away. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Izzie Kae

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for birding
customer_reviews.text: Bought this used. It came looking like new. Super lens for birding. A bit hard to focus. Fairly steady with the stabilizer. Would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: garyg

customer_reviews.title: Great in low light!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this camera for a year, and it has performed exactly as I had hoped. I have used this camera extensively in low light, from night shots, to building interiors and I am constantly amazed at the quality of low light photos. The zoom is obviously excellent, so I wont elaborate on that. The camera is light enough to hike with, easy to shoot with, and versatile. I like mine so much that my dad got the same one, and he is just as happy with his. The best camera purchase i have ever made...
customer_reviews.author: cucs

customer_reviews.title: Such a good buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have had an amazing experience with this camera so far. If you are looking to be able to take some high quality pictures and feel like a professional photographer without jumping into the high end DSLR pond, I highly recommend this camera. I've been able to capture some great memories and I can't wait for my friend's wedding in a few months!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I have owned every version of the powershot series. I debated a long time before buying this model. I read many reviews both good and bad. I bought the camera with the idea that if I did not like it, I would ship it back. I have not been disappointed. Of course the zoom is phenomenal. I like taking pictures of the moon and they are just brilliant. It focuses much faster than the sx40, the image stabilizer is very effective, works very good in low light and the size and weight is just perfect. One thing I really like is the rechargeable battery. The lithium battery is a plus. The sx50 is a great camera.
customer_reviews.author: daylebread

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera
customer_reviews.text: I use this camera all the time. The 50X zoom is wonderful for capturing details of distant scenes. It produces beautiful pictures in automatic mode and can be used in several creative modes as well as full manual. Not a DSLR camera, but a very good step up from a standard point and shoot.
customer_reviews.author: CrisMar1

customer_reviews.title: It had to be able to zoom into to the bird and still get a fairly good picture. This camera does this
customer_reviews.text: I needed a camera that was light weight so I could document bird sighting in the field. It had to be able to zoom into to the bird and still get a fairly good picture. This camera does this. It slips easy into my big vest pocket. It is fairly rugged to take my active lifestyle. Plus it was the affordable. I am very pleased with it. I do wish it had a docking station to charge it up when I am not using it but that is a little thing.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Camera
customer_reviews.text: I am finally learning to use many of the options on this camera. It is truly wonderful for taking snapshots out tour bus windows. It also takes lovely videos and still photos. I have also used the portrait setting with good results. I am really impressed with its versatility. I also appreciate the 50x optical zoom for wildlife photos.
customer_reviews.author: Christie Parker

customer_reviews.title: I used it in the Badlands National Park to get some wildlife photos at dusk that I'm really happy with. Focussing can be tricky
customer_reviews.text: This camera has a huge focal length range with image stabilization. I used it in the Badlands National Park to get some wildlife photos at dusk that I'm really happy with. Focussing can be tricky at long focal lengths, though. The bighorn sheep photo was at ISO 800, although not zoomed all the way out. These sheep were at least 50 yard away. The camera was hand held, although braced on a fence.
customer_reviews.author: AJK

customer_reviews.title: A real winner
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific camera that provides wonderful flexibility and excellent, clear and sharp photos. It has amazing image stabilization to complement its powerful zoom capability. I recommend it heartily. Two things to be aware of: 1) the lens cap has a propensity to pop off and is easy enough to forget to replace anyway, so getting a UV filter has been useful for me as a way to protect the lens itself; and (2) it's also easy to forget to turn the LCD screen around when putting it away so I recommend a screen cover for it.
customer_reviews.author: Phil G

customer_reviews.title: Far better than my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I am a very serious photographer. Normally I avoid digicams with small sensors because their images are noisy. Somehow, Canon has controlled the noise very well -- far beyond my expectations. Everything else is great too. I photograph birds a lot and love the extreme zoom. Since I got this, my SLR and 500mm lens hasn't gotten out much. This is just too good.
customer_reviews.author: Scientist

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase I made in a while, this camera is great, the zoom is amazing, and good quality of pictures. I recommend buying an additional battery which does not cost that much around $11 and I recommend the "SanDisk Extreme Plus 32GB SDHC UHS-1 Flash Memory Card Speed Up To 80MB/s" as memory card and you are good to go and ready to take awesome pictures of your next adventure.
customer_reviews.author: A.J

customer_reviews.title: Great point & shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: It's amazing how quickly technology has improved since I bought a Canon Xti a while back. I consider this point and shoot a much better camera as I'm not a photography buff and I probably overbought when I did the Xti. The zoom and clarity on this is fantastic, as I've taken maximum zoom shots that have clarity and detail. This is very important to me such that the little glitches like repeatedly pressing the timer-set function is not irritating (yet). Now if I can get someone to buy my Xti, I'll really be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Ben

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. I added the CHDK (Canon Hackers Development Kit) package thinking I needed it to get good shots of the moon. Nope. This camera, despite whatever others have said, takes quite lovely moon shots on the auto setting. CHDK is awesome and indispensable, but this camera is a joy and totally usable without any add-ons. It makes even my shoddy photo skills look pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Takes' confessions of regret

customer_reviews.title: Beats the competition, especially at that price point.
customer_reviews.text: Am very pleased with the results I'm getting from this camera so far. It's very close in size, weight and balance to my previous Canon and the controls are located where I expect them. The zoom exceeded my expectations and the camera is far easier to take into the field than I thought. I can now get up close and personal with birds, wildlife and even insects like never before. This thing is just plain fun with a rich feature set that I've just begun to explore.
customer_reviews.author: Gunter J. Steffen

customer_reviews.title: A Good Camera....
customer_reviews.text: I wish there was a lockout on the back surface controls. It seems like I end up in the "Self Timer" mode by accident every time I pick it up. UGH!! Takes very good snapshots........lightwieght, good zoom capabilites. Focus gets confused sometimes. Not a professional camera but a great amature one........
customer_reviews.author: cnh46

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I'm a rookie to photography. I debated on on the latest Lumix superzoom vs. the SX50 for months but pulled the trigger on the SX50. The camera is incredibly easy to operate in any mode and i'm just touching the surface of what you can do with this thing. I like the fact i don't have to carry around different lenses and all that mess either. Do yourself a favor and get a tripod while your ordering. When you zoom this baby in all the way it will be a little jumpy, the tripod takes care of that.
customer_reviews.author: coachman

customer_reviews.title: works as I read it would
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it much. Taking my time and reading up on it. We had the largest full Moon that's been seen for years. I went out, after dark, and zoomed in on it. The Moon filled the screen. I took several pictures and they were really sharp. Amazing, I was just holding it in my hands. Also it's the first camera I've had that works fine in the "auto" setting. Colors, sharpness, contrast, etc.are almost perfect. Putting it on "P" didn't improve the picture.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Lohr

customer_reviews.title: Sure shots/Close Ups
customer_reviews.text: I am taking the best pictures because I can scope in, especially the birds. I still have some trouble capturing my little busy bee relatives that only fleet by, but I am working on it. It has a good ability to stabilize and is light enough I can hold still even on long zooms. As the reviews said, it does not do well in moonlight, but I can live with that. Got a review sheet to get better at other features. I am still not good at switching modes and keep hitting wrong buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Neilah Desiree

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! Highly recommended for all! I used it to shoot fireworks this year and am posting the images. It has special settings for night, snow, portraits and yes, fireworks!
customer_reviews.author: jc

customer_reviews.title: It's a learning curve for beginners but the pics are amazing
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I have had a couple of weeks to play with it and actually also got a book on digital photography to get a better handle on all the lingo and functions on the camera. It's a bit overwhelming and I have barely scratched the surface but the pics that I have taken are incredible. It gets a bit frustrating at times as I accidentally hit/change something and then don't know how I got there but that's not the camera's fault, more my novice experience. I have taken some amazing night shots of the moon (handheld), very impressive.
customer_reviews.author: ParentBuyer in SF

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable electronic viewfinder
customer_reviews.text: Camera just arrived a few days ago. I was frustrated by the electronic viewfinder, until I reviewed the part names in the "Getting started" booklet which showed the Diopter Adjustment Dial next to the viewfinder. I was able to adjust it easily to suit my 'mature' eyes with trifocals. Now I am very happy with electronic viewfinder. Now on to taking stunning photos!
customer_reviews.author: N. Saint

customer_reviews.title: Great camera! ...quick shipping and excellent (new) condition in box with all instructions.
customer_reviews.text: This Amazon purchase was a gift for a family member after he raved about how much he liked mine! I've had many cameras and this is my favorite point and shoot camera. It takes fantastic high quality pictures, rivaling DSLR cameras at a fraction of the price and avoiding all the hassle. It can zoom in quite far with crisp images and capture great sport shots as well as close-ups of a subject and blurring the background if desired to bring out the subject.
customer_reviews.author: AnnS

customer_reviews.title: Very nice camera
customer_reviews.text: I have always had Nikons but wanted a bridge camera. This one fit the bill. Many differences in operating the camera from Nikon to Canon. My biggest complaint about the camera is that you need to grip the camera on the right side. All the controls are on the right side. Therefore I am constantly hitting something. That is the reason for 4 stars instead of 5. The lens on the camera is fantastic. Also wish the flash would have a dedicated pop up button, instead you have to manually open the flash
customer_reviews.author: double-oh

customer_reviews.title: This camera for the price is great. The battery almost never wears out
customer_reviews.text: This camera for the price is great. The battery almost never wears out. I can pick it up months later and it works. It holds a ton of picks with the right card. I used it across Europe and got lifetime shots. So simple to use. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Jim R.

customer_reviews.title: SX50 Camera
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera now for about 9 months. I have taken about 1000 pictures, several videos and I can not find fault with anything. The videos in low light conditions are better than I had hoped for. The automatic setting works well when there isn't time for manual settings. Battery life is good, but I bought an extra one so I don't worry about losing shots when away from home. It's lightweight so it's easy to carry and use for long periods of time. I would recommend this camera for anyone needing up to 50X optical zoom.
customer_reviews.author: Gary A. Tomlinson

customer_reviews.title: Super zoom camera excellent for birding.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for the 50X which I use for birding and It works very well for telephoto. It has many features which I have not tried out for other purposes. The problem I have with the camera is that it doesn't work well with my hands which are small. In holding the camera, I am pressing on control buttons and changing settings I don't mean to change. I don't like the swingout screen as I moslty shoot with the evf and have to stop and open the screen to review. The photo quality is similar to my Lumix DMC-FZ35. In spite of the akwardness to use, I would buy this camera again for the awesome zoom.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Cantu

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this camera. It takes great pictures. It has a very powerful zoom which is the primary feature my wife wanted in a camera. It is very user friendly for those just wanting to take pictures; yet, it has enough features to satisfy the professional photographer want-to-bes. The only drawback is that you cannot put regular batteries in it. All the other features and functions greatly outweigh having to use Canon's batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great zoom lens.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a Canon SX40 HS for some time and have always enjoyed excellent results. The SX50 produces just as great results with the added telephoto capability of the 1200mm. I also own several Canon EOS cameras with lenses of all focal lengths. The SX 50 allows me to be lazy and not carry a heavy camera bag with the EOS of choice and all the lenses necessary to match the capabilities of the SX50. Oh, for the simple life!!
customer_reviews.author: GozoGuru

customer_reviews.title: Great camera.
customer_reviews.text: Recently bought my wife a Canon DSLR for her birthday. She has been carrying her camera when we go on scooter rides and taking pictures whenever we stop. I've been bitten by the photography bug watching her. I wanted something that was easy to use, as well as easy to carry (no extra lenses to lug around). Read the reviews here on Amazon and watched many videos on Youtube about this camera. I am really enjoying the SX50 and have taken some pretty cool pictures. The zoom capabilities are awesome! My wife and I are enjoying the quality time together.
customer_reviews.author: A. Holton

customer_reviews.title: Great versatile camera
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful, easy to use camera. My friend had this exact model and I liked it so much, I decided to try and find it and sure enuf, I found it on Amazon. Really versatile camera, lots of information on the CD enclosed with the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Range with Light Weight
customer_reviews.text: This had what I was looking for - light weight for walking long distances and wide range for shooting things far off. Have had it several weeks now and am pleased with it. Has some drawbacks - mainly hard to fix location on birds from a distance before they move again, but overall, I've gotten some quite decent shots. Already own 2 DSRL's but they are heavy! Would buy it again - and for the price it's fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Lanie T

customer_reviews.title: the zoom is excellent! I might have been playing around with it ...
customer_reviews.text: I had some blurry shots but I might blame myself or others before the camera. I bought this for a trip to Africa, the zoom is excellent! I might have been playing around with it too much and at the wrong time because most of my shots from the trip did not come out as clear as I had hoped. The slightest disturbance can ruin a picture, you really have to have a steady hand, I thought I did but I was on a vehicle which was easily shaken by any movement.
customer_reviews.author: Random_Zander

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I like the lightweight feel of it, but at the same time, how it gives the feeling of a DSLR without the weight. The features are great. I am still experimenting with the camera features, and trying to figure out what goes where. One function I find missing is the ability of the camera to create panoramic views (or maybe I haven't figured that out yet). The zoom function is amazing! I also like the tracking AF function too. Really useful camera from Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Wai

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a replacement for the Canon SX40. It takes beautiful photos even on the fully automatic setting. The auto focus is much quicker and more accurate than the sx 40. Of course the huge zoom lens is wonderful. This camera takes great low light photos. I have taken many indoor photos using existing light and all have come out great. I do not like flash photos and it is rarely ever needed with the SX50. I very highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: D. Barnhill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Choice of Camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Cannon Camera because a neighbor of mine has one. I used it at Christmas time and was convinced that this is the Camera that I wanted to purchase for a long time. There are so many Cameras on the market that I was confused as to which one would fit my needs. When I had the chance to use the one that my neighbor owns I was sold on it and ordered one the next day. It takes beautiful pictures. The zoom is great because it allows me to get a close up shot without my being close up. I just love this Cannon Camera. I now consider it my Christmas present to myself.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Canon
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Easy to use and does well with both stills and video. I have only 2 complaints. First, why did Canon not include the $5 USB cord with this camera? And 2nd, why was Canon so cheap and put a bayonet mount on the lens instead of the normal thread on for filters? All filters have threads, so why would you NOT put threads on the lens? Just plain stupid.
customer_reviews.author: Bear

customer_reviews.title: Great super zoom.
customer_reviews.text: Great super zoom camera. I have had many long or semi super zoom cameras this one seems to be the best. AF is very good and the ability to zoom in is fantastic. I use the camera in the RAW mode which is an added advantage. A great camera to carry for any photo event such as birds or wild life.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Really good camera
customer_reviews.text: I had the Canon S1 (I think) 5 mp camera which I liked a lot. I admit that this camera produces better images and has more bells and whistles that I can imagine. The sensor must be greatly improved over the last few years as I get much better images at higher iso's. The stability control is also rather impressive. I didn't need the camera. I was impulsive to buy it. Not my smartest financial decision. I am so glad that I did. For me it is a great camera.
customer_reviews.author: BridgeImages

customer_reviews.title: The 50x zoom is awesome. For an amateur like myself
customer_reviews.text: This is one heck of a point-and-shoot camera. The 50x zoom is awesome. For an amateur like myself, this camera was well worth the money. It's not too heavy, easy to hold and gets accurate shots. My only beef is that I really don't like the buttons on the right side on the back of the camera. I pressed them accidently a number of times. I wish they were on the left.
customer_reviews.author: Don Lee

customer_reviews.title: its my camera.
customer_reviews.text: I had a Nikon p510 for 8 months. then I saw this one in one of my visits to amazon. I also looked at the comparisons on an internet site. I bought it and since then I hardly touch the Nikon camera. it works faster, has a better and bigger battery. the zoom is better. plus the cap pushes out the camera with the lens, not like on the Nikon. in my opinion this one is better than the Nikon p510.
customer_reviews.author: Simcha

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this camera for 4 years now. The zoom on it is magnificent. We own a camp on the lake and it's a mile to get across to the other side. I can zoom all the way to the otherside and see people in their yards. I love this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy L. King

customer_reviews.title: Good crisp images
customer_reviews.text: This camera has a learning curve, especially to take advantage of all the unbelievable features. We have gotten some stunning results out of it, and the zoom is all it promises. The viewfinder is not nearly as good as on my 7D, but that's a camera that costs almost four times what this one does. I paired the Powershot up with an inexpensive Vivatar wireless remote that provides a way of taking bird shots with the camera on a tripod, from long ranges. Camera is well worth the money, and the learning adventure is fun.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Brinckerhoff

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Birding.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is the perfect camera for birding.... 50x reach is amazing for getting ID shots of your birds. Been using this camera since March. It does have the typical Powershot issues with focus in low light, but the tradeoffs are worth it. I do question it's durability but for the price you can not have it all. I would buy it again for my use, which is a light mobile field camera for birding.
customer_reviews.author: M. Burnett

customer_reviews.title: finally A real camera even I can use
customer_reviews.text: My husband has purchased many cameras for me. I love taking pictures of the family, nature, our golden retrievers.... I was not satisfied with the zoom on my GE or the quality on my kodak. I wanted a point and shoot that took pictures like a dslr well this is that camera. The zoom is amazing, the clarity phanominal, and very, very user friendly. Still pretty light even for a larger camera. I absolutely love the consecutive shots I can take when the dogs or kids are playing in the sports mode you never miss a goofy face or the perfect jump with the dogs. I highly recommend this as user friendly and professional grade pics..
customer_reviews.author: wendy rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Many features
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had the time to really check out all the features on this camera yet, other than sort of cursory. So many! I doubt I'll ever learn everything this camera can do. However, so far so good. The only thing I wished Canon would have done, is to provide a written manual instead of having to go online to either print it (some 280 pages) yourself of try to browse through it on one's own.
customer_reviews.author: B Chan

customer_reviews.title: Birthday present he loved
customer_reviews.text: My husband has only started to learn to use this camera, but he's delighted already at the clarity of the pictures. And for a man who won't read directions to pick it up and start shooting in 2 minutes, I'd say they designed the camera well. It wasn't exactly "unbox and go"; I did have to charge the battery the night before and a mem card separately. Still, it's a fabulous camera and we're both really happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel

customer_reviews.title: Does not include cord to download pics
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this camera. It is not an SLR, which I'm used to using, but the fantastic zoom and ease of use makes up for the difference. It is much easier to travel with, it's lighter in weight, and I don't have to lug around longer lenses with me everywhere. However, I was shocked that this camera did not include a cord with which to download the pictures to a computer. I was fortunate to have one from my Canon Rebel SLR that works fine with this camera, but it is ridiculous to have buy one separately.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Sue

customer_reviews.title: Best of Both Worlds
customer_reviews.text: ALMOST in true love...Canon has a few quirks that I wish they would work out. One is low-light focusing and the other is the purple satellites around the sun. That said, this is the best 'bridge' camera I've tried. I have a few Canon Powershot point & shoots and a Canon REBEL DSLR. This combines the best of both...and those pesky quirks from both.
customer_reviews.author: D. Tegtmeier

customer_reviews.title: NIfty camera
customer_reviews.text: I planned to buy super zoom camera and was waging in between Panasonic and Canon. After reviews and comparison I decide Canon would be the better candidate. I'm old Panasonic customer and was unpleasantly surprised with their new product. They don't use Leica lenses (at least not on this product) and Canon is superior camera even it is a year older than new Panasonic. Strange and weird.
customer_reviews.author: Anatolij Strangar

customer_reviews.title: Great Point and Shoot with a super zoom
customer_reviews.text: Really like this camera. The zoom lens has great depth of field and is not the cruel joke many super zooms on the market are nowadays. With a fast enough SD Card 80mb/s+ full 1080p high def video is possible. At around 30mb/s 720p is good quality. Stereo Sound recording is a plus. Last but not least, it's great to get a point and shoot style camera that is capable of taking RAW format images. Took this camera to Alaska and got the best eagle pictures of my life with it. Canon has a winner here!
customer_reviews.author: Leo Strick

customer_reviews.title: Best camera I have ever owned.  Great for wildlife shots!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best camera I have ever owned. Easy to operate. Easy to record films. It takes fantastic photos from very far away (200 yards) of wildlife and the moon. All the photos are HD quality.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa WoolvertonJohnson

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera! The long zoom is good and stabilization is pretty good too. For the money, you can't go wrong. I have taken some fantastic long range shots with this camera. If you are on a budget or have space requirements on a trip, this is a great all in one kind of camera.
customer_reviews.author: M FN K

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband who has been looking for a new camera for months. This one does everything he wants and is just the right size and weight. Very easy to use as well - didn't have to read a lot of instructions before we could start taking amazing pictures. Plus - I ordered it on Sunday night and had it before noon on Wednesday. Couldn't have asked for better service and shipping and all at a greatly reduced price from others we had been looking at.
customer_reviews.author: Martha M. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the Nikon 520
customer_reviews.text: The camera focus is much faster than the Nikon 520 I had purchased just a month before I returned it and bought the Canon. I wasn't sure that the Canon would be much faster than the Nikon, but I was leaving on a family vacation very soon so I figured it would be a good test. I was thrilled with the camera on the trip, it focused fast so I got some good shots of my 1 year old granddaughter running around and on the rides at Disneyland. It also worked well in low light at the park. My one wish is that the lens was faster, would have been nice to have a 1.8 aperture for portrait shots.
customer_reviews.author: Macrod

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Camera
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a 4yr old Samsung digital. I started out on full auto, and I was very impressed with the zoom and overall picture quality. I have used the flash several times and those shots are well lit, good color and no red eye. The face recognition and AF work great. Now getting beyond full auto and controls are easy to use. Very satisfied with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Sue S.

customer_reviews.title: I'm thrilled
customer_reviews.text: It takes great quality pics. Excellent zoom. It is very comfortable to hold. I'm still learning to use all its features, but I am extremely happy with it. The only down side that I can mention right now, is that when using all the zoom, you have to have a very steady hand or use a tripod to take a perfect pic. and unfortunately, the programs that come in the CD are for mac 10.6 and up, and I have a 10.5.8, so I haven't been able to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Nedith V.

customer_reviews.title: It's a pretty good camera!
customer_reviews.text: So far, I'm pretty satisfied with this camera, although I've only had it a couple weeks. I like having the option of a viewfinder or video screen. It's pretty light and easy to use. I'm only disappointed with a couple of things. One is the relatively narrow aperture (f3.8), but I've experimented with shooting at a higher ISO and the noise isn't too bad, even at 6400. The other is that, so far, I haven't found any way of editing the HDR settings. I think it's just a single process with no editing capability.
customer_reviews.author: John Macdonald

customer_reviews.title: amazing Zoom
customer_reviews.text: takes great pictures , I am not a photographer but the one thing I really like is that you can hold the camera button down just a little bit and expose your photo in the darker light if you have back lighting so you expose for your subject without a backlight button
customer_reviews.author: Brad L.

customer_reviews.title: very dependable
customer_reviews.text: excellent; have had it for over 8 years and just took some great photos today A few days ago, the moon was full. and as it was sneaking through the forest behind my place, I took 4 fascinating shots that invited hundreds of likes on Facebook.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Mohamed Rabie

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a birder and have resisted taking pictures for years. This camera takes incredible pictures of birds and is very easy to use. It is better than the SX-60 by far. I've spoken to a lot of people that have both and everyone loves the 50.
customer_reviews.author: yve morrell

customer_reviews.title: Thrilled
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th Canon camera since the days of the film A-1. I love photographing wildlife and this camera does it all so well. Last trip out was photographing 14 Desert Bighorn. With a tripod and the telephoto I got shots where their eye color was visible. Close-ups like I've never imagined. Just added a monopod to my gear for those hard to get spur of the moment shots. Highly recommend this great camera.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Love It!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am loving my Canon PowerShot SX50 HS Digital Camera! Still learning the dos and don'ts. It takes beautiful pictures even when you are just learning! I was blown away with the optical zoom. I would highly recommend this camera to anyone that wants such a smart camera that won't empty your wallet!! Very pleased with my choice!!!
customer_reviews.author: Susie Q

customer_reviews.title: One of the best bridge cameras for the money has all the manual ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the best bridge cameras for the money has all the manual modes and then some tremendous zoom power! 50 times what else do you need to cope with any situation plus a 24 mm wide angle, raw and J peg or both of the same picture, HDR etc etc. great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Victor V.

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. Not a fancy high end camera but all I wanted was a good point and shoot. The 50x zoom is amazing. The camera takes great pictures. I had had this camera for a few years and have taken thousands of pictures. Has a lot of very useful features.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Scharle

customer_reviews.title: Great camera! Love the zoom!
customer_reviews.text: I received this camera for my birthday last year and I love it. After a year I am still learning to use it but I just love the 50x zoom feature. I can take amazing pictures of the moon or the live nature that I call my backyard. Now I just wish that I didn't have satellite internet and limited data so that I can share and upload my pictures daily!
customer_reviews.author: Amra

customer_reviews.title: Best camera ever
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to learn how to use this camera and it takes awesome pics. It really needs a steady surface for extreme zoom, but the quality is great. Takes excellent wildlife photos and moving shots. Also good for indoor photos (I use it to photograph my work as a kitchen and bath designer). Just remember, the flash is not automatic--you must pull up the flash if you need it. The rechargeable battery lasts much longer than my old Canon and charges quickly. Couldn't be happier with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot SX50 HS 12MP Digital Camera with 2.8-Inch LCD (Black)
product_meta.description:
Style:BasePowerShot SX50 HS is world's first 50x Optical Zoom lens in a compact digital camera, which goes all the way from a wide-angle 24mm to 1200mm (35mm equivalent) to capture any shot you choose. The PowerShot SX50 HS features the Canon HS SYSTEM, a combination of a 12.1 Megapixel High-Sensitivity CMOS sensor and the DIGIC 5 Image Processor, achieves beautiful images up to ISO 6400. Video recording is available at 1080p Full HD and High Speed AF ensures you'll capture all the action with faster focusing speed and reduced shooting lag time.
What’s in the box: Canon PowerShot SX50 HS Digital Camera, NB-10L Lithium-Ion Battery Pack for PowerShot SX50 HS, CB-2LC Battery Charger for NB-10L Battery for PowerShot SX50 HS, Neck Strap NS-DC11, Digital Camera Solution CD, Lens Cap with Strap and 1-Year Limited Warranty.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 Untitled Document 


THE WORLD'S WITHIN YOUR REACH
Imagine getting right down on the field to capture sports action, zeroing in on your child's expression on a crowded stage, and recording elusive wildlife shots. All this and more is possible with the PowerShot SX50 HS offering the world's first 50x Optical Zoom lens* in a compact digital camera, which goes all the way from a wide-angle 24mm to 1200mm (35mm equivalent) to capture any shot you choose. The PowerShot SX50 HS doesn't just get you up close to the action, it delivers spectacular image quality to every shot. The Canon HS SYSTEM, a combination of a 12.1 Megapixel High-Sensitivity CMOS sensor and the DIGIC 5 Image Processor, achieves beautiful images up to ISO 6400. Record your memorable moments in incredibly lifelike 1080p Full HD video with stereo sound and High Speed AF ensures you'll capture all the action with faster focusing speed and reduced shooting lag time. The PowerShot SX50 HS also features the additional benefit of Zoom Framing Assist Seek and Lock functions, for easy tracking of and keeping the subject centered in the frame until you capture the image. With powerful technologies that add convenience and advanced capabilities, PowerShot SX50 HS can help you capture more of life every day.

* As of August 21, 2012.

EVERY SHOT WITHIN YOUR REACH
WORLD'S FIRST 50X OPTICAL ZOOM (24–1200MM) AND 24MM WIDE-ANGLE LENS* WITH OPTICAL IMAGE STABILIZER DELIVERS MAGNIFICENT IMAGES WHETHER YOU ARE UP CLOSE OR FAR AWAY.
Experience the difference that the ultra-zooming power of the PowerShot SX50 HS's 24mm Wide-Angle 50x Optical Zoom lens can make on your everyday shooting. The extraordinary focal length of 4.3–215.0mm (35mm film equivalent: 24–1200mm) lets you capture everything from wide-angle shots to super-telephoto shots from wherever you are, while every shot exhibits the unique quality inherent to Canon optics. You'll easily reach into sporting events from up in the bleachers, catch beautiful candid shots of your children without disrupting the scene, and achieve wildlife and landscape photography you never thought possible. Canon's Optical Image Stabilizer ensures that whether up close or far away, every shot is clear and steady.

* As of August 21, 2012.

ZOOM FRAMING ASSIST
It's easy to track and capture subjects while using the extreme telephoto on the PowerShot SX50 HS. Use the Zoom Framing Assist Seek function to locate and track your subjects even a long distance away; by simply pressing a button, this function remembers your previous zoom position, zooms out to let you locate your subject, and zooms right back into the saved position when you release the button. And with the Zoom Framing Assist Lock, the camera will lock onto and automatically track a subject, intelligently keeping them in the center of the frame until you're ready to capture the perfect close-up shot.

BEAUTIFUL IMAGES AND FAST PERFORMANCE START HERE
12.1 MEGAPIXEL HIGH-SENSITIVITY CMOS SENSOR
The PowerShot SX50 HS employs a Canon 12.1 Megapixel CMOS sensor, which delivers state-of-the-art imaging performance and is optimized for use in compact cameras. Utilizing a sophisticated light-capturing design, it provides high sensitivity for improved high ISO capture with reduced noise. It is also a high-speed design, capable of rapidly capturing and moving image data to the processor, enabling faster continuous shooting and faster autofocus.

CANON DIGIC 5 IMAGE PROCESSOR
The latest-generation Canon DIGIC 5 Image Processor works with the PowerShot SX50 HS's image sensor to bring phenomenal increases in processing speed and power, delivering incredible detail in more situations, without the need for artificial light sources. Improved noise reduction produces clearer images when shooting in low light at high ISO speeds. The faster processing speed results in faster continuous shooting capability while maintaining full image quality. With the power of the DIGIC 5 Image Processor, the PowerShot SX50 HS can achieve higher ISO sensitivity and even perform advanced functions like lens correction, special scene modes and much more.


CANON HS SYSTEM FOR EXCEPTIONAL LOW-LIGHT PERFORMANCE UP TO ISO 6400
The PowerShot SX50 HS gives you the power to create images with spectacular depth, detail and emotional resonance. The 12.1 Megapixel High-Sensitivity CMOS sensor works in concert with Canon's latest-generation DIGIC 5 Image Processor to create the renowned Canon HS SYSTEM. With the Canon HS SYSTEM, you'll experience excellent tracking performance even in low light, and achieve gorgeous still image quality even at high ISO speeds all the way up to ISO 6400; beautiful low-light shots are possible with minimal noise and maximum detail in highlight and shadow areas. The Canon HS SYSTEM lets you use higher shutter speeds to capture clearer images with reduced noise and blur in a variety of situations for incredible photos and even when shooting video.

GET THE COMPLETE HD EXPERIENCE
CAPTURE STUNNING 1080P FULL HD VIDEO IN STEREO SOUND WITH A DEDICATED MOVIE BUTTON; ZOOM WHILE SHOOTING AND PLAY BACK VIDEOS ON AN HDTV VIA THE HDMI OUTPUT.
 Simply touch the dedicated movie button, now conveniently embedded in the PowerShot SX50 HS's thumb pad, to start recording video in 1080p Full HD that is breathtakingly vivid and realistic. You're free to use the full range of the zoom in movie mode, and sound is recorded in stereo. HDMI output allows you to view and share your video on an HDTV immediately, simply by connecting the camera to the TV with an optional HDMI cable. 

FASTER FOCUS AND HIGH-SPEED SHOOTING
HIGH SPEED AF GREATLY IMPROVES FOCUS SPEED AND HIGH-SPEED BURST HQ ALLOWS FOR CONTINUOUS CAPTURE AT A MAXIMUM OF 10 FRAMES* WHILE MAINTAINING SUPERB IMAGE QUALITY.
The PowerShot SX50 HS is equipped with Canon's latest advancement in AF technology: High Speed AF. The result of several improved technologies, High Speed AF delivers significantly faster focus speed of 0.19 seconds and a dramatically reduced shooting lag time of only 0.25 seconds, for a super-responsive shooting experience that lets you capture every great shot as it happens. The technology also powers the camera's new High-Speed Burst HQ, with continuous capture at a maximum speed of approximately 13 fps. Moreover, images captured in High-Speed Burst HQ maintain the camera's superb image quality.

*The continuous shooting speed is approximately 13.0 fps.

OPTIMAL IMAGE STABILIZATION IN ANY SITUATION
INTELLIGENT IS AUTOMATICALLY CHOOSES FROM SIX DIFFERENT MODES TO OPTIMIZE IMAGE STABILIZATION FOR THE SHOOTING CONDITION.
It's easy to capture clear, steady images with the PowerShot SX50 HS, even in low light without using a tripod. That's because the camera is equipped with Canon's innovative Intelligent IS. The system analyzes camera movement and applies the best shake correction method for the shooting situation – allowing you to focus on framing and capturing your shot. For stills, the system automatically selects among Normal, Panning, Macro (Hybrid) and Tripod IS modes. When shooting video, the system automatically selects among Dynamic, Powered, Macro and Tripod IS modes. Dynamic IS has been enhanced to provide better performance than ever before, now compensating for rotational movement centered on the optical axis in addition to horizontal tilt and vertical pitch, for beautifully clear and steady video.

Normal Corrects for a wide range of camera movement when shooting stills. Panning Panning motion is detected so that IS does not interfere with desired camera movement. Macro (Hybrid) Corrects for shift-type camera shake, which typically occurs in macro (close-up) shooting. Dynamic Effective for video shooting at wide-angle focal lengths, eliminating the unwanted shaking that typically occurs while walking. Powered Compensates for hand movement when shooting video at the telephoto end of the zoom range, where camera shake is magnified. Tripod When tripod use is detected, the Image Stabilizer is stopped because it is not needed. CONVENIENT SHOOTING FLEXIBILITY
BRIGHT 2.8-INCH VARI-ANGLE LCD WITH 461,000 DOTS FOR SHOOTING AT A VARIETY OF ANGLES, PLUS AN ELECTRONIC VIEWFINDER.
 The PowerShot SX50 HS gives you lots of ways to frame a great shot. The bright 2.8-inch Vari-angle LCD has excellent resolution (approximately 461,000 dots), and flips out and swivels/rotates for shooting at unusual angles, even letting you capture perfectly framed self-portraits. The camera also has an Electronic Viewfinder to give you the classic photographic experience. 

AUTOMATICALLY OPTIMIZE VIRTUALLY ANY SHOT
SMART AUTO INTELLIGENTLY SELECTS THE PROPER CAMERA SETTINGS BASED ON 58 PREDEFINED SHOOTING SITUATIONS AND THE FACE ID FUNCTION ADJUSTS FOCUS AND EXPOSURE PRIORITY BASED ON PRE-REGISTERED FACES.
In Smart AUTO, the PowerShot SX50 HS analyzes various factors in the scene's background and subject, then selects optimal camera settings based on predefined shooting situations to achieve the best possible image quality. The Smart AUTO function on PowerShot SX50 HS includes an astonishing 58 predefined shooting situations, giving you spectacular image quality in virtually any photographic conditions you'll encounter. 

Canon's futuristic Face ID feature allows you to register up to 12 faces on your camera, then gives those faces priority over others with regard to focus and exposure. As a result, even in group scenes, you'll always get great shots of your children, family and friends. 

SHOOTING MODES
PowerShot cameras offer shooting modes that make it easy to take perfect photos in a wide range of shooting situations by providing intelligent presets with optimized settings.

SHOOTING MODES/SPECIAL SCENE MODES
Custom Define and store your own settings to achieve the effects you prefer. Manual You have complete control of exposure, selecting both aperture and shutter speed manually. Aperture-Priority You set the aperture, controlling depth-of-field. The camera automatically selects the shutter speed. Shutter-priority You select the shutter speed to stop or blur action, and the camera finds the appropriate aperture. With slow exposure times, Canon's noise reduction system activates to ensure low image noise. Program Access advanced exposure compensation features while shooting mostly automatically. Smart AUTO The camera automatically selects the best shooting settings for optimal quality based on subjects and environmental factors to provide point-and-shoot simplicity. Movie Digest Records a video clip before capturing a still image and then combines one day’s worth of clips into a video. Now easily playback and review clips, and delete unwanted scenes. Sports The camera uses high shutter speeds to capture fast-moving subjects. Portrait The camera sets a large aperture, focusing the subject and artistically blurring the background to make your subject “pop.” Smooth Skin Removes dullness, wrinkles, and harsh shadows for beautiful faces. Smart Shutter The camera automatically takes the photo when people smile, wink, or get into frame. High-Speed Burst HQ Captures fast-action shots at full sensor resolution, by shooting continuously when the shutter button is held down. Handheld Night Scene Take clear and steady pictures at night without the use of a tripod. Snow Shoot clear snow scenes without darkened subjects or an unnatural bluish tint. Fireworks Grab brilliant images of skyrocketing fireworks. Stitch Assist Easy-to-use guidelines simplify the shooting of aligned multiple frames that can later be combined (using bundled software) to create panoramic photos. Creative Filters This setting provides easy access to special filter effects and scene modes, such as Toy Camera Effect, Poster Effect, Monochrome and more. High Dynamic Range The camera combines three different exposures to get one evenly lit image. Nostalgic Create the look and feel of old photographs using sepia tones and black-and-white. Miniature Effect for Movies & Stills Emphasizes perspectives for a miniature effect by blurring upper and bottom portions of the image. Soft Focus Creates a hazy ambiance that’s perfect for portraits and wedding photos. Super Vivid Super Vivid intensifies existing hues, saturating the scene with bright colors. Color Accent Choose to retain a single color in your image while other colors turn monochrome. Color Swap Select a color and replace it with a color you specify for special effects. Movie Record video in stereo sound. Unwanted scenes can be deleted in playback mode. iFrame Movie The Apple® movie format, iFrame, makes it easier and quicker to import and upload videos while retaining high image quality. Super Slow Motion Movie Record your clips in high speed (approx. 240 fps), and then watch your videos in slow motion. SET YOUR CREATIVITY FREE
FULL RANGE OF SHOOTING AND RECORDING MODES INCLUDING RAW+JPEG FOR THE ULTIMATE CREATIVE CONTROL.
 As with many EOS DSLR cameras, the PowerShot SX50 HS uses a 12-bit converter to process the output of the CMOS sensor, resulting in true color, smooth tonal transitions and natural gradations. The PowerShot SX50 HS lets you shoot in RAW mode, which records all the information captured by the sensor, giving you outstanding flexibility and complete creative control when editing your images with Canon's powerful bundled software, and the camera allows you to record in RAW and JPEG formats simultaneously. Now in RAW mode, you can even select among several aspect ratios, including 16:9, 3:2, 4:3, 1:1, and 4:5. 

READY TO EXPAND YOUR CREATIVE OPTIONS
BUILT-IN HOT SHOE ALLOWS COMPATIBILITY WITH OPTIONAL SPEEDLITE FLASHES FOR ADDITIONAL LIGHTING OPTIONS.
 When you're ready to take your creativity further with the lighting and exposure possibilities of an optional Canon Speedlite, the PowerShot SX50 HS is ready too. The camera has a built-in hot shoe that makes it compatible with a variety of Speedlite flashes. 

ADDITIONAL FEATURES
DIRECT CONNECT TO YOUR PRINTER
 It's quick and easy to make beautiful prints from your PowerShot camera with Canon's Direct Print system. Directly connect your PowerShot camera to a Canon PIXMA or SELPHY photo printer with a USB cable (Sold separately) and simply press the button to print; turn every favorite moment into an amazing photo. 

AVAILABLE IN 30 LANGUAGES
There are now a total of 30 display languages from which you can choose: English, German, French, Dutch, Danish, Finnish, Italian, Norwegian, Swedish, Spanish, Simplified/Traditional Chinese, Japanese, Russian, Portuguese, Korean, Greek, Polish, Czech, Hungarian, Turkish, Thai, Arabic, Romanian, Ukrainian, Farsi, Hindi, Malay, Indonesian and Vietnamese.
